# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r"[\s\t]+")
    lines = String[]
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = string(word)
        else
            line *= word * " "
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line) # last line might not be filled up to text_width
    join(lines, "\n")
end

# example usage:
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed commodo, magna ac bibendum aliquam, ex nulla facilisis nibh, id viverra mi lorem eu tellus. Praesent sodales tincidunt velit, eu congue est lacinia ut."
println(wrap_string(text))
```
